content.question: Which of the following statements best describes Charles Darwin's theory of evolution?

choices.label: Changes in species result from periodic catastrophic geological events that alter the environment.
All creatures living today descended from a single common ancestor in an inevitable process.
The emergence of new species, as seen in the fossil record, is attributable solely to genetic mutations.
Species tend to reproduce geometrically but their subsistence grows arithmetically.
New species emerge after gradually accumulating new modifications.

content.answer: New species emerge after gradually accumulating new modifications.
